**Hack 1.0** is the first public release of [Hack](/wiki/Hack "Hack"). [Andries Brouwer](/wiki/Andries_Brouwer "Andries Brouwer") published it to the (now-obsolete) [Usenet](/wiki/Usenet "Usenet") newsgroup net.sources in December 1984.

[ ]

- [2 The adventurer](#The_adventurer)

  - [5.11 Gems](#Gems)
  - [5.12 Other items](#Other_items)

## Availability

All 15 of the original Dec 1984 Usenet posts are available. The first 14 are available on Google Groups, while part 15 (Message-ID: <6257\@mcvax.UUCP>) is available at "news019f2/b34/net/sources/2145" in the UTZOO Wiseman Usenet Archive.

- [Part 1](https://groups.google.com/groups?selm=6243%40mcvax.UUCP)
- [Part 2](https://groups.google.com/groups?selm=6244%40mcvax.UUCP)
- [Part 3](https://groups.google.com/groups?selm=6245%40mcvax.UUCP)
- [Part 4](https://groups.google.com/groups?selm=6246%40mcvax.UUCP)

[Ali Harlow](/wiki/Ali_Harlow "Ali Harlow")[\[1\]](http://www.juiblex.co.uk/nethack/front.html) has a Hack 1.0 distribution at [\[2\]](http://www.juiblex.co.uk/nethack/source/ab_hack-1.0.tar.gz); this is also available on NetHackWiki for browsing and annotation: [Hack 1.0 source code](/wiki/Hack_1.0_source_code "Hack 1.0 source code").

## The adventurer

The player may choose a [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist"), a [Speleologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist"), a [Fighter](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), a [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), a [Cave-man](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman"), or a [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard"). No option to play as female is available.

The adventurer has [experience](/wiki/Experience "Experience"), [hit points](/wiki/Hit_points "Hit points"), [armor class](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class"), and [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"). He may advance to [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 14.

The initial [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") is a little [dog](/wiki/Dog "Dog").

## Dungeon features

The dungeon in Hack 1.0 has no branches; there is one way up and one way down. The first 25 levels or so consist of rooms, and beyond that, the adventurer encounters mazes.

Special rooms are [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop"), [treasure zoos](/wiki/Treasure_zoo "Treasure zoo"), and [vaults](/wiki/Vault "Vault"). If the player's login name is "david", David's Treasure Zoo appears much more frequently.

The "david" in question is [David S. H. Rosenthal](/wiki/David_S._H._Rosenthal "David S. H. Rosenthal"), who worked with [Andries Brouwer](/wiki/Andries_Brouwer "Andries Brouwer") in 1982. One of David's students at the Universiteit van Amsterdam demonstrated the need for the [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") to have a limited wallet and be very strong when made angry by theft. A [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging") was used to tunnel into the shop, and items were repeatedly removed and sold back to the shopkeeper; at that time, the shopkeeper had a bottomless wallet and never got angry, so the student became extraordinarily rich overnight.

Traps are:

- [bear trap](/wiki/Bear_trap "Bear trap")
- [arrow trap](/wiki/Arrow_trap "Arrow trap")
- [dart trap](/wiki/Dart_trap "Dart trap")
- [trapdoor](/wiki/Trapdoor "Trapdoor")
- [teleportation trap](/wiki/Teleportation_trap "Teleportation trap")
- [pit](/wiki/Pit "Pit")
- [sleeping gas trap](/wiki/Sleeping_gas_trap "Sleeping gas trap")

The [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") is found under a boulder in a maze level. The [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") does not appear in Hack 1.0.

## Objects

### Artifacts

Hack 1.0 has only one [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact"), [Orcrist](/wiki/Orcrist "Orcrist"). Any weapon may be named Orcrist and will do d10 extra points damage to [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(monster\) "Orc (monster)"). There can even be more than one Orcrist.

### Amulets

Only the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor") and the cheap plastic imitation exist in Hack 1.0.

### Food

Food items in Hack 1.0 are:

- [food ration](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration")
- [tripe ration](/wiki/Tripe_ration "Tripe ration")
- [pancake](/wiki/Pancake "Pancake")
- [dead lizard](/wiki/Lizard_corpse "Lizard corpse")
- [fortune cookie](/wiki/Fortune_cookie "Fortune cookie")
- [carrot](/wiki/Carrot "Carrot")
- [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin")
- [orange](/wiki/Orange "Orange")
- [apple](/wiki/Apple "Apple")
- [pear](/wiki/Pear "Pear")
- [melon](/wiki/Melon "Melon")
- [banana](/wiki/Banana "Banana")
- [candy bar](/wiki/Candy_bar "Candy bar")
- [egg](/wiki/Egg "Egg")
- [clove of garlic](/wiki/Clove_of_garlic "Clove of garlic")
- [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") (called *dead foo* rather than *foo corpse*)

The tin did not contain the remains of monsters, but rather a randomly-chosen food such as peaches or, if the adventurer is lucky, [spinach](/wiki/Spinach "Spinach").

The dead lizard was a found object rather than a corpse; live lizards did not exist in Hack 1.0. It could reduce [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion"), but had no effect on [cockatrices](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice").

### Weapons

Weapons in Hack 1.0 are:

- [arrow](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow")
- sling bullet
- [crossbow bolt](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt")
- [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart")
- [rock](/wiki/Rock "Rock")
- [boomerang](/wiki/Boomerang "Boomerang")
- [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace")
- [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe")
- [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail")
- [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword")
- [two handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword")
- [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")
- [worm tooth](/wiki/Worm_tooth "Worm tooth")
- [crysknife](/wiki/Crysknife "Crysknife")
- [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear")
- [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow")
- [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling")
- [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow")

### Tools

Tools in Hack 1.0 are:

- [whistle](/wiki/Tin_whistle "Tin whistle")
- [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle")
- [expensive camera](/wiki/Expensive_camera "Expensive camera")
- [ice box](/wiki/Ice_box "Ice box")

The ice box is the only container. Then as now, it preserved corpses, and was generally too heavy (and too rare) to be useful for inventory management.

### Armor

Armor items in Hack 1.0 are:

- [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet")
- [plate mail](/wiki/Plate_mail "Plate mail")
- [splint mail](/wiki/Splint_mail "Splint mail")
- [banded mail](/wiki/Banded_mail "Banded mail")
- [chain mail](/wiki/Chain_mail "Chain mail")
- [scale mail](/wiki/Scale_mail "Scale mail")
- [ring mail](/wiki/Ring_mail "Ring mail")
- [studded leather armor](/wiki/Studded_leather_armor "Studded leather armor")
- [leather armor](/wiki/Leather_armor "Leather armor")
- [elven cloak](/wiki/Elven_cloak "Elven cloak")
- [shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield")
- [pair of gloves](/wiki/Leather_gloves "Leather gloves")

### Potions

Potions in Hack 1.0 are:

- [potion of restore strength](/wiki/Potion_of_restore_ability "Potion of restore ability")
- [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze")
- [potion of invisibility](/wiki/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility")
- [potion of fruit juice](/wiki/Potion_of_fruit_juice "Potion of fruit juice")
- [potion of healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing")
- [potion of paralysis](/wiki/Potion_of_paralysis "Potion of paralysis")
- [potion of monster detection](/wiki/Potion_of_monster_detection "Potion of monster detection")
- [potion of object detection](/wiki/Potion_of_object_detection "Potion of object detection")
- [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness")
- [potion of confusion](/wiki/Potion_of_confusion "Potion of confusion")
- [potion of gain strength](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_ability "Potion of gain ability")
- [potion of speed](/wiki/Potion_of_speed "Potion of speed")
- [potion of blindness](/wiki/Potion_of_blindness "Potion of blindness")
- [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level")
- [potion of extra healing](/wiki/Potion_of_extra_healing "Potion of extra healing")
- [potion of levitation](/wiki/Potion_of_levitation "Potion of levitation")

### Scrolls

Scrolls in Hack 1.0 are:

- [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor")
- [scroll of destroy armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_destroy_armor "Scroll of destroy armor")
- [scroll of confuse monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_confuse_monster "Scroll of confuse monster")
- [scroll of scare monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_scare_monster "Scroll of scare monster")
- [scroll of blank paper](/wiki/Scroll_of_blank_paper "Scroll of blank paper")
- [scroll of remove curse](/wiki/Scroll_of_remove_curse "Scroll of remove curse")
- [scroll of enchant weapon](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_weapon "Scroll of enchant weapon")
- scroll of damage weapon
- [scroll of create monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_create_monster "Scroll of create monster")
- [scroll of taming](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming")
- [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide")
- [scroll of light](/wiki/Scroll_of_light "Scroll of light")
- [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation")
- [scroll of gold detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_gold_detection "Scroll of gold detection")
- [scroll of food detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_food_detection "Scroll of food detection")
- [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify")
- [scroll of magic mapping](/wiki/Scroll_of_magic_mapping "Scroll of magic mapping")
- [scroll of amnesia](/wiki/Scroll_of_amnesia "Scroll of amnesia")
- [scroll of fire](/wiki/Scroll_of_fire "Scroll of fire")
- [scroll of punishment](/wiki/Scroll_of_punishment "Scroll of punishment")

The scroll of damage weapon acts as the modern scroll of enchant weapon does when [cursed](/wiki/Curse "Curse"). The scroll of genocide acts, in all cases, as the modern blessed scroll; but most symbols refer to only one monster anyway.

### Wands

Wands in Hack 1.0 are:

- [wand of light](/wiki/Wand_of_light "Wand of light")
- [wand of secret door detection](/wiki/Wand_of_secret_door_detection "Wand of secret door detection")
- [wand of create monster](/wiki/Wand_of_create_monster "Wand of create monster")
- [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing")
- [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking")
- [wand of slow monster](/wiki/Wand_of_slow_monster "Wand of slow monster")
- [wand of speed monster](/wiki/Wand_of_speed_monster "Wand of speed monster")
- [wand of undead turning](/wiki/Wand_of_undead_turning "Wand of undead turning")
- [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph")
- [wand of cancellation](/wiki/Wand_of_cancellation "Wand of cancellation")
- [wand of teleport monster](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation")
- [wand of make invisible](/wiki/Wand_of_make_invisible "Wand of make invisible")
- [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging")
- [wand of magic missile](/wiki/Wand_of_magic_missile "Wand of magic missile")
- [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire")
- [wand of sleep](/wiki/Wand_of_sleep "Wand of sleep")
- [wand of cold](/wiki/Wand_of_cold "Wand of cold")
- [wand of death](/wiki/Wand_of_death "Wand of death")

### Rings

Rings in Hack 1.0 are:

- [ring of adornment](/wiki/Ring_of_adornment "Ring of adornment")
- [ring of teleportation](/wiki/Ring_of_teleportation "Ring of teleportation")
- [ring of regeneration](/wiki/Ring_of_regeneration "Ring of regeneration")
- [ring of searching](/wiki/Ring_of_searching "Ring of searching")
- [ring of see invisible](/wiki/Ring_of_see_invisible "Ring of see invisible")
- [ring of stealth](/wiki/Ring_of_stealth "Ring of stealth")
- [ring of levitation](/wiki/Ring_of_levitation "Ring of levitation")
- [ring of poison resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance")
- [ring of aggravate monster](/wiki/Ring_of_aggravate_monster "Ring of aggravate monster")
- [ring of hunger](/wiki/Ring_of_hunger "Ring of hunger")
- [ring of fire resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_fire_resistance "Ring of fire resistance")
- [ring of cold resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_cold_resistance "Ring of cold resistance")
- [ring of protection from shape changers](/wiki/Ring_of_protection_from_shape_changers "Ring of protection from shape changers")
- [ring of conflict](/wiki/Ring_of_conflict "Ring of conflict")
- [ring of gain strength](/wiki/Ring_of_gain_strength "Ring of gain strength")
- [ring of increase damage](/wiki/Ring_of_increase_damage "Ring of increase damage")
- [ring of protection](/wiki/Ring_of_protection "Ring of protection")
- [ring of warning](/wiki/Ring_of_warning "Ring of warning")
- [ring of teleport control](/wiki/Ring_of_teleport_control "Ring of teleport control")

Because [charisma](/wiki/Charisma "Charisma") does not exist in Hack 1.0, the ring of adornment is a useless item.

### Gems

Gems in Hack 1.0 are:

- [diamond](/wiki/Diamond "Diamond")
- [ruby](/wiki/Ruby "Ruby")
- [sapphire](/wiki/Sapphire "Sapphire")
- [emerald](/wiki/Emerald "Emerald")
- [turquoise stone](/wiki/Turquoise_stone "Turquoise stone")
- [aquamarine stone](/wiki/Aquamarine_stone "Aquamarine stone")
- [tourmaline stone](/wiki/Tourmaline_stone "Tourmaline stone")
- [topaz stone](/wiki/Topaz_stone "Topaz stone")
- [opal stone](/wiki/Opal_stone "Opal stone")
- [garnet stone](/wiki/Garnet_stone "Garnet stone")
- [amethyst stone](/wiki/Amethyst_stone "Amethyst stone")
- [agate stone](/wiki/Agate_stone "Agate stone")
- [onyx stone](/wiki/Onyx_stone "Onyx stone")
- [jasper stone](/wiki/Jasper_stone "Jasper stone")
- [jade stone](/wiki/Jade_stone "Jade stone")

and worthless pieces of blue, red, yellow, and green glass.

### Other items

Other items not appearing in the above categories are:

- [heavy iron ball](/wiki/Heavy_iron_ball "Heavy iron ball")
- [iron chain](/wiki/Iron_chain "Iron chain")
- [enormous rock](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder")

It is not possible to pick up an iron chain, nor can they be generated from [iron golems](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem"), because these do not exist in Hack 1.0.
html:
Hack 1.0

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

NetHack Versions

  • Jay Fenlason's Hack
    • HACK for UNIX
    • Hack 1.21 for DOS
    • Hack for PDP-11
    • PC/IX Hack
  • Andries Brouwer's Hack
    • Hack 1.0
    • Hack 1.0.1
    • Hack 1.0.2
    • Hack 1.0.3
  • Early NetHack
    • NetHack 1.3d
    • NetHack 1.4f
    • NetHack 2.2a
    • NetHack 2.3e
  • The NetHack 3.0 Series
    • NetHack 3.0.0
    • NetHack 3.0.1
    • NetHack 3.0.2
    • NetHack 3.0.3
    • NetHack 3.0.4
    • NetHack 3.0.5
    • NetHack 3.0.6
    • NetHack 3.0.7
    • NetHack 3.0.8
    • NetHack 3.0.9
    • NetHack 3.0.10
  • The NetHack 3.1 Series
    • NetHack 3.1.0
    • NetHack 3.1.1
    • NetHack 3.1.2
    • NetHack 3.1.3
  • The NetHack 3.2 Series
    • NetHack 3.2.0
    • NetHack 3.2.1
    • NetHack 3.2.2
    • NetHack 3.2.3
  • The NetHack 3.3 Series
    • NetHack 3.3.0
    • NetHack 3.3.1
  • The NetHack 3.4 Series
    • NetHack 3.4.0
    • NetHack 3.4.1
    • NetHack 3.4.2
    • NetHack 3.4.3
  • The NetHack 3.6 Series
    • NetHack 3.6.0
    • NetHack 3.6.1
    • NetHack 3.6.2
    • NetHack 3.6.3
    • NetHack 3.6.4
    • NetHack 3.6.5
    • NetHack 3.6.6
    • NetHack 3.6.7

Hack 1.0 is the first public release of Hack. Andries Brouwer published it to the (now-obsolete) Usenet newsgroup net.sources in December 1984.

Contents

  • 1 Availability
  • 2 The adventurer
  • 3 Dungeon features
  • 4 Bestiary
  • 5 Objects
    • 5.1 Artifacts
    • 5.2 Amulets
    • 5.3 Food
    • 5.4 Weapons
    • 5.5 Tools
    • 5.6 Armor
    • 5.7 Potions
    • 5.8 Scrolls
    • 5.9 Wands
    • 5.10 Rings
    • 5.11 Gems
    • 5.12 Other items

Availability

All 15 of the original Dec 1984 Usenet posts are available. The first 14 are available on Google Groups, while part 15 (Message-ID: <6257@mcvax.UUCP>) is available at "news019f2/b34/net/sources/2145" in the UTZOO Wiseman Usenet Archive.

  • Part 1
  • Part 2
  • Part 3
  • Part 4
  • Part 5
  • Part 6
  • Part 7
  • Part 8
  • Part 9
  • Part 10
  • Part 11
  • Part 12
  • Part 13
  • Part 14
  • Part 15

Ali Harlow[1] has a Hack 1.0 distribution at [2]; this is also available on NetHackWiki for browsing and annotation: Hack 1.0 source code.

The adventurer

The player may choose a Tourist, a Speleologist, a Fighter, a Knight, a Cave-man, or a Wizard. No option to play as female is available.

The adventurer has experience, hit points, armor class, and strength. He may advance to experience level 14.

The initial pet is a little dog.

Dungeon features

The dungeon in Hack 1.0 has no branches; there is one way up and one way down. The first 25 levels or so consist of rooms, and beyond that, the adventurer encounters mazes.

Special rooms are shops, treasure zoos, and vaults. If the player's login name is "david", David's Treasure Zoo appears much more frequently.

The "david" in question is David S. H. Rosenthal, who worked with Andries Brouwer in 1982. One of David's students at the Universiteit van Amsterdam demonstrated the need for the shopkeeper to have a limited wallet and be very strong when made angry by theft. A wand of digging was used to tunnel into the shop, and items were repeatedly removed and sold back to the shopkeeper; at that time, the shopkeeper had a bottomless wallet and never got angry, so the student became extraordinarily rich overnight.

Traps are:

  • bear trap
  • arrow trap
  • dart trap
  • trapdoor
  • teleportation trap
  • pit
  • sleeping gas trap

The Amulet of Yendor is found under a boulder in a maze level. The Wizard of Yendor does not appear in Hack 1.0.

Bestiary

The following monsters may be encountered:

Name Symbol Notes
acid blob a  
bat B  
centaur C  
chameleon :  
cockatrice c Stoning by hissing is an instadeath
demon &  
dog d  
dragon D As the modern red dragon
ettin e  
floating eye E  
fog cloud f  
freezing sphere F  
gelatinous cube g  
ghost (space)  
giant ant A  
giant beetle b  
giant rat r  
gnome G  
guard @  
hobgoblin H  
homunculus h  
imp i  
jackal J  
jaguar j  
killer bee k  
kobold K  
large dog d  
leocrotta l  
leprechaun L  
little dog d  
long worm w if NOWORM not defined at compile time
lurker above ~  
mimic M  
minotaur m  
nurse n  
nymph N  
orc O  
owlbear o  
piercer p  
purple worm P  
quasit Q  
quivering blob q  
rust monster R Reduces enchantment rather than truly rusting
scorpion s  
shopkeeper @  
snake S  
stalker I  
tengu t  
trapper ,  
troll T  
umber hulk U  
unicorn u  
vampire V  
violet fungi v  
wraith W  
wumpus w if NOWORM defined at compile time
xan x  
xorn X  
yellow light y  
yeti Y  
zombie Z  
zruty z  

Objects

Artifacts

Hack 1.0 has only one artifact, Orcrist. Any weapon may be named Orcrist and will do d10 extra points damage to orcs. There can even be more than one Orcrist.

Amulets

Only the Amulet of Yendor and the cheap plastic imitation exist in Hack 1.0.

Food

Food items in Hack 1.0 are:

  • food ration
  • tripe ration
  • pancake
  • dead lizard
  • fortune cookie
  • carrot
  • tin
  • orange
  • apple
  • pear
  • melon
  • banana
  • candy bar
  • egg
  • clove of garlic
  • corpse (called dead foo rather than foo corpse)

The tin did not contain the remains of monsters, but rather a randomly-chosen food such as peaches or, if the adventurer is lucky, spinach.

The dead lizard was a found object rather than a corpse; live lizards did not exist in Hack 1.0. It could reduce confusion, but had no effect on cockatrices.

Weapons

Weapons in Hack 1.0 are:

  • arrow
  • sling bullet
  • crossbow bolt
  • dart
  • rock
  • boomerang
  • mace
  • axe
  • flail
  • long sword
  • two handed sword
  • dagger
  • worm tooth
  • crysknife
  • spear
  • bow
  • sling
  • crossbow

Tools

Tools in Hack 1.0 are:

  • whistle
  • magic whistle
  • expensive camera
  • ice box

The ice box is the only container. Then as now, it preserved corpses, and was generally too heavy (and too rare) to be useful for inventory management.

Armor

Armor items in Hack 1.0 are:

  • helmet
  • plate mail
  • splint mail
  • banded mail
  • chain mail
  • scale mail
  • ring mail
  • studded leather armor
  • leather armor
  • elven cloak
  • shield
  • pair of gloves

Potions

Potions in Hack 1.0 are:

  • potion of restore strength
  • potion of booze
  • potion of invisibility
  • potion of fruit juice
  • potion of healing
  • potion of paralysis
  • potion of monster detection
  • potion of object detection
  • potion of sickness
  • potion of confusion
  • potion of gain strength
  • potion of speed
  • potion of blindness
  • potion of gain level
  • potion of extra healing
  • potion of levitation

Scrolls

Scrolls in Hack 1.0 are:

  • scroll of enchant armor
  • scroll of destroy armor
  • scroll of confuse monster
  • scroll of scare monster
  • scroll of blank paper
  • scroll of remove curse
  • scroll of enchant weapon
  • scroll of damage weapon
  • scroll of create monster
  • scroll of taming
  • scroll of genocide
  • scroll of light
  • scroll of teleportation
  • scroll of gold detection
  • scroll of food detection
  • scroll of identify
  • scroll of magic mapping
  • scroll of amnesia
  • scroll of fire
  • scroll of punishment

The scroll of damage weapon acts as the modern scroll of enchant weapon does when cursed. The scroll of genocide acts, in all cases, as the modern blessed scroll; but most symbols refer to only one monster anyway.

Wands

Wands in Hack 1.0 are:

  • wand of light
  • wand of secret door detection
  • wand of create monster
  • wand of wishing
  • wand of striking
  • wand of slow monster
  • wand of speed monster
  • wand of undead turning
  • wand of polymorph
  • wand of cancellation
  • wand of teleport monster
  • wand of make invisible
  • wand of digging
  • wand of magic missile
  • wand of fire
  • wand of sleep
  • wand of cold
  • wand of death

Rings

Rings in Hack 1.0 are:

  • ring of adornment
  • ring of teleportation
  • ring of regeneration
  • ring of searching
  • ring of see invisible
  • ring of stealth
  • ring of levitation
  • ring of poison resistance
  • ring of aggravate monster
  • ring of hunger
  • ring of fire resistance
  • ring of cold resistance
  • ring of protection from shape changers
  • ring of conflict
  • ring of gain strength
  • ring of increase damage
  • ring of protection
  • ring of warning
  • ring of teleport control

Because charisma does not exist in Hack 1.0, the ring of adornment is a useless item.

Gems

Gems in Hack 1.0 are:

  • diamond
  • ruby
  • sapphire
  • emerald
  • turquoise stone
  • aquamarine stone
  • tourmaline stone
  • topaz stone
  • opal stone
  • garnet stone
  • amethyst stone
  • agate stone
  • onyx stone
  • jasper stone
  • jade stone

and worthless pieces of blue, red, yellow, and green glass.

Other items

Other items not appearing in the above categories are:

  • heavy iron ball
  • iron chain
  • enormous rock

It is not possible to pick up an iron chain, nor can they be generated from iron golems, because these do not exist in Hack 1.0.
